thought.author: Holy Bible (Proverbs 27:1)
description: ðŸ’¡ There are a lot of reasons for doing #PairProgramming. But ultimately it's about #Teamwork; it requires excellent communication and mutual respect.
thought.quote: As iron sharpens iron, so one person sharpens another.

thought.author: Ralph Johnson
description: Today's issue of #ThoughtsOnProgramming features Ralph Johnson, co-author of the "Design Pattern bible" with a friendly reminder on the importance of creating software which is useful to specific users for achieving a defined goal effectively and with efficiency.
thought.quote: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.

thought.author: Linus Torvalds
description: Happy Monday Everybody ðŸŽ‰, today's #ThoughtsOnProgramming features Mr. #LinuxKernel Linus Torvalds with a controversial quote on GNOME's lack of usability back in the early 2000s when the project decided to remove a couple of features to provide an enhanced base user experience.
You can find this highly entertaining morning reading here.
thought.quote: If you think your users are idiots, only idiots will use it.
